title: Virtual Reality-Based Instructional Design to Enhance Self-Awareness and Egocentric Learning in Schizophrenia Patients

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Knowledge of Schizophrenia Symptoms and Cognitive Rehabilitation, Experience with Virtual Reality (VR) Devices
context.additional_context: Practitioner training course to improve schizophrenia patients' self-awareness deficits and spatial navigation learning disabilities through VR-based activities

learning_goals: Design personalized learning scenarios that improve egocentric spatial navigation abilities of schizophrenia patients in virtual reality environments by over 20%
Develop learning effectiveness metrics by analyzing prefrontal cortex-posterior cingulate cortex connectivity activation patterns identified in fMRI studies
Implement a 3-tier self-awareness training module (basic-advanced-integrated) based on schizophrenia symptom severity (positive/negative symptoms)
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
